intro: Hibbertia diamesogenos, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and narrow, serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Hibbertia diamesogenos is often found in shrublands and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
